sections.summary: Supervised learning uses gradient descent to optimize parameters via loss functions like MSE and cross entropy.
Compute linear output, apply sigmoid; minimize cross entropy for maximum likelihood estimation using gradient descent; use specific loss functions.
Build model M from training data D, compute parameters θ, and maximize likelihood for predictions P model.
Maximize log likelihood of model P(y_i | x_i, θ) as a sum for optimization.
Log likelihood maximization involves optimizing parameters θ; entropy and cross entropy measure encoding efficiency for probability distributions.
MLE maximizes likelihood; minimizing cross entropy equals maximizing likelihood, with cross entropy loss as a specific case.
Training data consists of noisy outputs from a linear function, modeled with Gaussian noise for regression learning.
Maximize likelihood using MSE as loss function for linear data perturbed by Gaussian noise, optimizing w for predicted values.
